page.title: 13LANDSCAPE IN CRANAGE AREA
page.content: Looking across our area you would notice that it is very flat and lush green over a large part.The area is covered with hedgerows and small areas of woodland. These have mostly deciduous trees and a wide variety of birds and animals live there. The rivers Dane and Croco flow through the area where locals can fish for fresh water fish. The land near the Dane is only 30 feet above sea-level. The land rises steeply to 61 feet where the village of Holmes Chapel has been developed away from the danger of flooding. The M6 runs through a deep cutting in the north of the block with embankments on either side. These have been re-landscaped to fit in with the surrounding countryside. Away from the main roads it is very quiet and peaceful.
